function.description: Toggles html+css+js+preview console
function.sample: JMVC.console();

function.description: Debugs on console any element passed, degrading to the alert
Removes a variable from the global JMVC register

params.param: the name of the new variable to be removed

function.description: Get a function with a delegated context

params.param: the function that must be binded to the object
the object where the function must be binded

function.description: Extends JMVC object with Your objects

params.param: that parameter is needed to set the namespace under which Your functions will be added to JMVC; valid values are `foo` or even `foo1.foo2.foo3`
this object literal defines all the functions in your extension (JMVC is in that scope, so You can use it)

function.signature: JMVC.factory(String type, String name[, Array params])
function.description: Get a Model, View or Interface

params.param: specify the kind of object should be returned, accepted values area 'view', 'model', 'controller' and 'interface'

the name for the object, that will be used in the xhr path. Will be searched in the Models dir, so is possible to use a relative path as objects/person to get the model within the /app/models/objects/person.js file
all parameters for the object constructor call

function.description: Retrieves a variable from the global JMVC scope

params.param: the name of the new variable to be retrieved

function.returns: the variable reference or value if found, or undefined
function.sample: JMVC.set('a', 10); console.debug(JMVC.get('a'));

function.description: This is a shortcut call for JMVC.factory, with the first parameter preset to 'model'

params.param: the name of the model that should be returned, even on a subfolder
all parameters for the object constructor call

function.description: This is a shortcut call for JMVC.factory, with the first parameter preset to 'view'

params.param: the name of the new view

function.sample: var me = JMVC.getView('foot'); console.debug(me.content);

function.description: That function allows to add a function to four inner predefined hook queues; it is possible to define through that method even new hooks and trigger execution anywhere in your code using the function hookCheck. Note that 'onBeforeRender', 'onAfterRender', 'onBeforeParse', 'onAfterParse' are existent inner hooks used at parse and render time.

params.param: the object literal containing hooked functions
hook the function even if the hook is not in the expected set ['onBeforeRender', 'onAfterRender', 'onBeforeParse', 'onAfterParse']

function.description: That function is strictly coupled with the JMVC.hook function, triggering a named hook.

params.param: the name of the hook queue that must be executed

parameters array for the hooked functions; chained, being a queue the first function specified will pass his returning values as parameters for the second function in the queue, an so on. The sample code clarifies.

function.returns: the element returned from the last fucntion

function.description: Gets a view instance, even on a subfolder

params.param: the string that must be changed

function.description: Gets a view instance, even on a subfolder

params.param: the string that must be changed

function.description: Gets a model instance, even on a subfolder

params.param: an array of target functions that caracterize the interface

function.description: Implements a true inheritance (D.C. way if you prefer)

params.param: the child object that must inherit
the parent object that will share his prototype with the `foo middle object`

function.description: A stupid wrappper around eval function
function.returns: what is returned by code evaluation
function.sample: var t = JMVC.jeval('return "yess";'); console.debug(t);

function.description: As far as `core/i18n/i18n` is loaded with JMVC.require an `onBeforeRender` hook queues a call to the JMVC.parselang which will look and replace lang placeholders. The JMVC.lang function add one or more language file to the set of files that can be used.

params.param: the name of the lang file

function.description: This is a shortcut call for the factory, with the first parameter preset to 'interface'

params.param: the name of the interface that must be loaded

function.sample: var me = JMVC.loadinterfaces('loader')

function.description: Returns a namespace if exists

params.param: The namespace to check, a String dot glued

function.signature: JMVC.nsMake(String str, Literal obj, var ctx)
function.description: Creates a namspace

params.param: The inner object of the namespace

function.description: Parses cnt looking for language placeholders [L[label]] and replacing them with the current(or default) language translation given in the app/i18n/XX.js lang file. That function is not mean to be called manually, it will be called by JMVC as a `onBeforeRender` hook as far as 'core/i18n' is required

Appends a 1px square iframe to the body, loading the specified url (from the same origin), and removes it as far as the content is loaded. That will speed up dramatically the loading time of the page pointed by the url

params.param: the url that must be loaded

function.description: Allows to add properties and methods to the prototype of a constructor

params.param: the literal object that contains wanted properties and methods

function.description: Nullifies tha object passed as parameter
Loads one or more extensions into the JMVC object

params.param: the name of the javascript file (must be in extensions folder) to be loaded. That file will use JMVC.extend function (see the `More` section)

function.description: Adds a variable that You can use anywhere

params.param: the name of the new variable, use it typing $thename$

param.name: W
param.description: JMVC.W is a reference to th current window object

function.description: Event is a special constructor to get an Event object with an attach and notify method
Create an interface object

params.param: the name for the interface (used in case of error)

function.description: Retrieves a variable from the global JMVC scope

params.param: the name of the new variable to be removed

function.description: Retrieves a variable from the global JMVC scope

params.param: the name of the new variable to be removed

function.description: Retrieves a variable from the global JMVC scope

params.param: the name of the new variable to be removed

function.description: Retrieves a variable from the global JMVC scope

params.param: the name of the new variable to be removed

function.description: Retrieves a variable from the global JMVC scope

params.param: the name of the new variable to be removed

function.description: Retrieves a variable from the global JMVC scope

params.param: the name of the new variable to be removed

function.description: Retrieves a variable from the global JMVC scope

params.param: the name of the new variable to be removed

function.description: removes from a model a variable
If exists retrieve a variable from the Model registry.

params.param: the name of the variable needed

function.returns: the variable value if exists or false

function.description: Deletes all variables from the Model registry.
Add a variable to the Model registry.
If exists deletes a variable from the View registry.

params.param: the name of the variable to be deleted

function.description: If exists deletes a variable from the View registry.

params.param: the name of the variable to be deleted

function.description: If exists retrieve a variable from the View registry.

params.param: the name of the variable needed

function.returns: the variable value if exists or false

function.description: If the view has some $var$ placeholders within and these variables are stored in a model instance with the right names, that method get values from model instance and uses them in the placeholders content substitution.

params.param: Is a Model instance which should contain variables that the view will render through placeholders substitution.

function.returns: the View instance (to access the content use .content attribute)

function.description: If the view has some $var$ placeholders within and these variables are stored in a model instance with the right names, that method get values from model instance and uses them in the placeholders content substitution.

params.param: Is a Model instance which should contain variables that the view will render through placeholders substitution.

function.returns: the View instance (to access the content use .content attribute)

function.signature: render(Literal pars{Javascript function cback, Array argz, String target})
function.description: This is the function intended to be used to render the document or a part of it. You can optionally pass three elements within a literal object.

params.param: a callback function that will be executed after rendering
an array of parameters that will be passed to the callback

the default target is document.body but if you pass a string containing the id attribute of an element that is in the\n\t\t\t\t\tDOM (set from previous render with the default target) the content will be set in that element.

function.description: Add a variable to the View registry.

If the view has some $var$ placeholders within and these variables are stored in a model instance with the right names, that method get values from model instance and uses them in the placeholders content substitution.

params.param: Is a Model instance which should contain variables that the view will render through placeholders substitution.

function.returns: the View instance (to access the content use .content attribute)

function.description: Add action routes.

params.param: a function that will be invoked after content is set

function.description: If exists deletes a variable from the Controller registry.

params.param: the name of the variable to be deleted

function.description: If exists retrieve a variable from the Controller registry.

params.param: the name of the variable needed

function.returns: the variable value if exists or false

function.description: Redirects to a specified location.

params.param: the location to be redirected to

function.description: Renders directly something from the controller, optionally invokes a callback at the end.

params.param: a function that will be invoked after content is set

function.description: Deletes all variables from the Controller registry.
Add a variable to the Controller registry.

function.signature: JMVC.dom.add(Element where, String tag, Literal attrs, String inner)
function.description: this is a shortcut that merges create+append

function.signature: JMVC.dom.addClass(Element where, String tag, Literal attrs, String inner)
function.description: this is a shortcut that merges create+append

function.description: this is a shortcut that merges create+append

function.signature: JMVC.dom.find(Element where, String tag, Literal attrs, String inner)
function.description: this is a shortcut that merges create+append
creates a DOM node.
Finds a node by id (#id) a class (.class) or a tag (tag).
Finds a node by id (#id) a class (.class) or a tag (tag).
Finds a node by id (#id) a class (.class) or a tag (tag).
Finds a node by id (#id) a class (.class) or a tag (tag).
sets or returns the html into an existing element.

params.param: html to set in target, otherwise gets it

function.description: inserts a sibling node after another one

params.param: the existing node where postpend the sibling

function.description: inserts a sibling node before another one

params.param: the existing node where prepend the sibling

function.description: inserts a sibling node before another one

params.param: the existing node where prepend the sibling

function.description: inserts a sibling node before another one

params.param: the existing node where prepend the sibling

function.description: inserts a sibling node before another one

params.param: the existing node where prepend the sibling

function.signature: JMVC.dom.nthchild(Element node, int num [, Array types ])
function.description: Get the n-th child of a given node; by default considers only TEXT_NODE types but You can specify any set

params.param: The parent where search n-th child
Starting from 0 the number of the child needed
An array containig the nodeTypes to consider

function.signature: JMVC.events.bind(Element el, String type, Javascript function func)
function.description: binds a callback to an event fired from an element
Delay the execution of a function
add a function to the end render queue
executes the end render queue
given an event sholud retrieve the original target for that event
given an element and a event, try to get event firing coordinates relative to the element
kills an event

function.signature: JMVC.events.loadify(Element el, String type, Javascript function fun)
function.description: binds a callback to an event fired from an element

function.signature: JMVC.events.one(Element el, String type, Javascript function fun)
function.description: binds only once a callback to an event fired from an element

function.signature: JMVC.events.onEventOut(String type, Element el, Javascript function cb)
function.description: Triggers a callback as the specified event is fired outside the specified element

function.signature: JMVC.events.preventDefault(Element el, String type, Javascript function fun)
function.description: binds only once a callback to an event fired from an element
binds a callback to document load event
binds a callback to document load event
binds a callback to document load event
binds a callback to document load event
binds a callback to document load event
binds a callback to document load event
unbinds an existing binding

function.signature: JMVC.head.addscript(String src, Boolean parse, Boolean explicit)
function.description: Add a script in the head section

params.param: this can be the url of the script or the script content (you can even use \{\{myscript name=`hello` ... \{\} )
set true if You mean to use JMVC.vars variables placeholders in the script
set true if You mean to pass the script content or a view placeholder in the src (even with on-the-fly variables), in that case 'parse' argument will be considered as true in any case

function.signature: JMVC.head.addstyle(String src, Boolean parse, Boolean explicit)
function.description: Add a stylesheet in the head section

params.param: this can be the url of the stylesheet or the stylesheet content (you can even use \{\{mystyle color=`#ff33cc` ... \}\} )
set true if You mean to use JMVC.vars variables placeholders in the stylesheet
set true if You mean to pass the stylesheet content or a view placeholder in the src (even with on-the-fly variables), in that case 'parse' argument will be considered as true in any case

function.signature: JMVC.head.denyiXrame(String src, Boolean parse, Boolean explicit)
function.description: Add a stylesheet in the head section

params.param: this can be the url of the stylesheet or the stylesheet content (you can even use \{\{mystyle color=`#ff33cc` ... \}\} )

set true if You mean to pass the stylesheet content or a view placeholder in the src (even with on-the-fly variables), in that case 'parse' argument will be considered as true in any case

function.description: Loads an external library

params.param: Library name, now only 'jquery' is available (use CDN)
